title: Silver Dollar Buttermilk-Pecan Pancakes with Bourbon Molasses Butter and Maple Syrup
summary: Silver Dollar Buttermilk-Pecan Pancakes with Bourbon Molasses Butter and Maple Syrup is a breakfast that serves 6. For $2.76 per serving, this recipe covers 15% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One serving contains 754 calories, 8g of protein, and 47g of fat. 1 person were glad they tried this recipe. A mixture of molasses, vanilla bean, brown sugar, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so flavorful. It is brought to you by Foodnetwork. It is a good option if you're following a lacto ovo vegetarian diet. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 55 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 30%, this dish is not so outstanding. Similar recipes are Walnut-Wheatgerm Silver Dollar Pancakes with Homemade Blackberry Syrup, Buttermilk Pecan Pancakes with Vanilla Bourbon Peaches and Syrup (Meatless Monday), and Silver Dollar Pancakes.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 200 degrees F.                          Whisk together the flour, pecans, granulated sugar, light brown sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a medium bowl. Whisk together the eggs, buttermilk, butter and vanilla extract and vanilla bean in a small bowl. Add the egg mixture to the dry mixture and gently mix to combine. Do not overmix. Let the batter sit at room temperature for at least 15 minutes and up to 30 minutes before using.                          Heat a cast iron or nonstick griddle pan over medium heat and brush with melted butter. Once the butter begins to sizzle, use 2 tablespoons of the batter for each pancake and cook until the bubbles appear on the surface and the bottom is golden brown, about 2 minutes, flip over and cook until the bottom is golden brown, 1 to 2 minutes longer. Transfer the pancakes to a platter and keep warm in a 200 degree F oven.                          Serve 6 pancakes per person, top each with some of the bourbon butter. Drizzle with warm maple syrup and dust with confectioners' sugar. Garnish with fresh mint sprigs and more toasted pecans, if desired.                          Bourbon Molasses Butter:                          Combine the bourbon and sugar in a small saucepan and cook over high heat until reduced to 3 tablespoons, remove and let cool.                          Put the butter, molasses, salt and cooled bourbon mixture in a food processor and process until smooth. Scrape into a bowl, cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour to allow the flavors to meld. Remove from the refrigerator about 30 minutes before using to soften.

steps.step: Preheat the oven to 200 degrees F.
Whisk together the flour, pecans, granulated sugar, light brown sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a medium bowl.
Whisk together the eggs, buttermilk, butter and vanilla extract and vanilla bean in a small bowl.
Add the egg mixture to the dry mixture and gently mix to combine. Do not overmix.
Let the batter sit at room temperature for at least 15 minutes and up to 30 minutes before using.

Heat a cast iron or nonstick griddle pan over medium heat and brush with melted butter. Once the butter begins to sizzle, use 2 tablespoons of the batter for each pancake and cook until the bubbles appear on the surface and the bottom is golden brown, about 2 minutes, flip over and cook until the bottom is golden brown, 1 to 2 minutes longer.
Transfer the pancakes to a platter and keep warm in a 200 degree F oven.
Serve 6 pancakes per person, top each with some of the bourbon butter.
Drizzle with warm maple syrup and dust with confectioners' sugar.
Garnish with fresh mint sprigs and more toasted pecans, if desired.
Combine the bourbon and sugar in a small saucepan and cook over high heat until reduced to 3 tablespoons, remove and let cool.
Put the butter, molasses, salt and cooled bourbon mixture in a food processor and process until smooth.
Scrape into a bowl, cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour to allow the flavors to meld.
Remove from the refrigerator about 30 minutes before using to soften.

title: Garlic Butter Shrimp
summary: Garlic Butter Shrimp is a delicious and easy-to-make dish. For $3.51 per serving, this recipe covers 20% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One serving contains 300 calories, 15g of protein, and 20g of fat. This recipe is liked by 10 foodies. A mixture of shrimp, garlic, butter, and a few other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so tasty. It is brought to you by Allrecipes. It is a good option if you're following a gluten-free diet. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 60 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 40%, this dish is solid. Similar recipes include Garlic Shrimp, Butter Shrimp, and Shrimp Garlic.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. In a small bowl, mix together melted butter, garlic, and cumin. Arrange shrimp in a single layer on a baking sheet. Pour the butter mixture over the shrimp and toss to coat. Arrange the cherry tomatoes around the shrimp. Sprinkle with salt to taste. Bake for 45 minutes until shrimp is pink and cooked through.

steps.step: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
In a small bowl, mix together melted butter, garlic, and cumin.
Arrange shrimp in a single layer on a baking sheet. Pour the butter mixture over the shrimp and toss to coat. Arrange the cherry tomatoes around the shrimp. Sprinkle with salt to taste.
Bake for 45 minutes until shrimp is pink and cooked through.

summary: Spinach and Dill Rice is a nutritious and flavorful side dish. For $1.80 per serving, this recipe covers 12% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. instructions: In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook until fragrant. Stir in the diced tomatoes and cook for 5 minutes. Add the fresh spinach and cook until wilted. Stir in the fresh dill and season with salt and pepper. Serve warm.

steps.step: In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat.

Add the fresh spinach and cook until wilted.
Stir in the fresh dill and season with salt and pepper. Serve warm.

title: Bacon and Zucchini Bites
summary: Bacon and Zucchini Bites are a delicious and easy appetizer. For $2.00 per serving, this recipe covers 10% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One serving contains 250 calories, 10g of protein, and 20g of fat. 500 people have tried this recipe and liked it. instructions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. In a large bowl, combine the grated zucchini, cooked bacon, melted butter, cream cheese, and shredded cheddar cheese. Mix well. Spoon mixture into a greased mini muffin tin. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm.

steps.step: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
In a large bowl, combine the grated zucchini, cooked bacon, melted butter, cream cheese, and shredded cheddar cheese. Mix well.
Spoon mixture into a greased mini muffin tin.
Bake for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown.
Serve warm.
